Journal.Title: The Psychiatric clinics of North America

Article.ArticleTitle: Immune Dysregulation in Treatment-Resistant Depression: Precision Approaches to Treatment Selection and Development of Novel Treatments.

AbstractText: Owing to the link between immune dysfunction and treatment-resistant depression (TRD) and the overwhelming evidence that the immune dysregulation and major depressive disorder (MDD) are associated with each other, using immune profiles to identify the biological distinct subgroup may be the step forward to understanding MDD and TRD. This report aims to briefly review the role of inflammation in the pathophysiology of depression (and TRD in particular), the role of immune dysfunction to guide precision medicine, tools used to understand immune function, and novel statistical techniques.
